title: Fort Smith National Historic Site: Federal Court (1872-1896)
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Places     Federal Court (1872-1896)                 Federal Court Era Places (1872-1896)         Restored Courtroom of Judge Isaac C. Parker Memories by Jody  Today visitors come to Fort Smith to see the federal courthouse used by Judge Isaac C. Parker from 1875-1889.  However, the building was originally the military barracks and not ideally suited for a courthouse.  The courtroom was small and not lavishly furnished.  The former mess halls in the basement were converted into two large jail cells, nicknamed "Hell on the Border."         Click here to view a 96 page report (PDF) on the Fort Smith courtroom which includes historical information on the court and its original furnishings.       Also check out:  Stories from the Federal Court Era People of the Federal Court Era
